docs.summary: Events that are triggered by actions on a site's members.
description: Events are triggered in your site's backend when certain changes occur to your site's members.
You can write event handlers that react to these events. Event handler functions
receive data that corresponds to the backend event that has occurred. Use event handlers
to create custom responses to the events.
Events are **not** triggered when previewing your site.
To add an event handler, add an **events.js** file to the **Backend** section
of your site if one does not already exist. All event handler functions for your
site are defined in this file.
Event handler functions are defined using the following pattern:
```javascript
export function <wixAppName>_<eventName>(event) { }
For example, an event handler that handles the approval of a site member looks
like this:
```javascript
export function wixMembers_onMemberApproved(event) { }

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a  is .
description: The `()` event handler runs when a is .
The received `` object contains information about the  that was .
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the site member that was approved.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member is approved.
description: The `onMemberApproved()` event handler runs when an existing site member is approved.
The received `ApprovedMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member that was approved.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the  site member that was blocked.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member is blocked.
description: The `(onMemberBlocked)` event handler runs when a site member is blocked.
The received `BlockedMember` object contains information about the  site member that was blocked.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the member that was created.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member is created.
description: The `onMemberCreated()` event handler runs when a site member is created.
The received `CreatedMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member that was created.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the site member that was deleted.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member is deleted.
description: The `onMemberDeleted()` event handler runs when a site member is deleted.
The received `DeletedMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member that was deleted.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the site member who joined the site community.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member joins the site community.
description: The `(onMemberJoinedCommunity)` event handler runs when site member joins the site community.
The received `JoinedMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member who joined the site community.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the site member who left the site community.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member leaves the site community.
description: The `(MemberLeftCommunity)` event handler runs when a site member leaves the site community.
The received `LeftMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member who left the site community.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the site member who was muted.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member is muted (they cannot leave comments, like or share posts).
description: The `(onMemberMuted)` event handler runs when a site member is muted.
The received `MutedMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member who was muted.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the site member who was unmuted.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member is unmuted (they can again leave comments, like or share posts).
description: The `(onMemberUnmuted)` event handler runs when a site member is unmuted.
The received `MutedMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member who was unmuted.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that is triggered when a site member's information is updated.
description: The `(onMemberUpdated)` event handler runs when a site member's information is updated.
The received `UpdatedMemberEvent` object contains information about the site member whose information was updated.
> **Note:** Backend events don’t work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An object representing the member that was approved.
An object representing the site member that was blocked.
An object representing the site member that was created.
An object representing the site member who joined the site community.
An object representing the site member who left the site community.
An object representing the site member that was deleted.
An object representing the site member who was muted.
An object representing the site member whose information was updated.
